data.name: CustomHandlerDataDescription
data.value: An Exception Handler implemented as a custom class added to Enterprise Library.

data.name: CustomHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Custom Exception Handler.

data.name: CustomHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Custom Exception Handler.

data.name: ExceptionHandlerDataDescription
data.value: Handles an exception passed to the block and performs an action on it, such as wrapping or logging it, and then passes it on to the next exception handler or returns it to the caller.

data.name: ExceptionHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Exception Handler.

data.name: ExceptionHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Exception Handler.

data.name: ExceptionHandlingSettingsDescription
data.value: Configuration settings for the Exception Handling Application Block.

data.name: ExceptionHandlingSettingsExceptionPoliciesDescription
data.value: Configuration settings for all Exception Handling Policies.

data.name: ExceptionPolicyDataDescription
data.value: A policy defines the exceptions it will handle, and the set of Exception Handlers that it will execute when one of the specified exceptions is passed to the block.

data.name: ExceptionPolicyDataExceptionTypesDescription
data.value: The Exception types configured for the Exception Handling Block.

data.name: ExceptionPolicyDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Exception Handling Policy.

data.name: ExceptionTypeDataDescription
data.value: Each Exception Type configured for a policy can specify a series of Exception Handlers that will execute when an exception of the specified type is sent to the block for handling by this policy.

data.name: ExceptionTypeDataExceptionHandlersDescription
data.value: The Exception Handlers configured for this Exception type.

data.name: ExceptionTypeDataPostHandlingActionDescription
data.value: The action the Exception Handling Block will take after executing all of the handlers for this Exception type. None means that the block will return false to the application allowing it to resume execution. NotifyRethrow means that the block will return true to the application, which should re-throw the original exception. ThrowNewException means that the block will throw the exception that exists after the final handler runs. However, if you use the overload of the HandleException method that takes an out parameter that returns the final exception from the handlers, it does not automatically throw the exception, and you must do this in your code.

data.name: ExceptionTypeDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Exception.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataDescription
data.value: Replaces the exception sent to the block with another exception type. The message can be specified for the replacement exception type.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataExceptionMessageDescription
data.value: The message for the replacement exception.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataExceptionMessageResourceNameDescription
data.value: The key in an external resource file for the localized string to use as the message for the replacement exception.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataExceptionMessageResourceTypeDescription
data.value: The type of the external resource file containing the localized string to use as the message for the replacement exception.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Replace Exception Handler.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataReplaceExceptionTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the replacement exception.

data.name: ReplaceHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Replace Exception Handler.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataDescription
data.value: Wraps the exception sent to the block as the inner exception of a new exception type. The message can be specified for the wrapping exception type.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataExceptionMessageDescription
data.value: The message for the wrapping exception.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataExceptionMessageResourceNameDescription
data.value: The key in an external resource file for the localized string to use as the message for the wrapping exception.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataExceptionMessageResourceTypeDescription
data.value: The type of the external resource file containing the localized string to use as the message for the wrapping exception.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataNameDescription
data.value: The name of the Wrap Exception Handler.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the Wrap Exception Handler.

data.name: WrapHandlerDataWrapExceptionTypeNameDescription
data.value: The fully qualified type name of the wrapping exception.
